results.title: Tweekage
results.brief_description: Skateboard enthusiasts will enjoy this hour of footage recording some of Australia’s top skaters performing impressive moves; kick flipping, sliding and grinding across Sydney, Melbourne, the Gold Coast and major skating events. For those of you who don’t skate you may be inspired to give it a try, although the SLAM section illustrates that even professionals are prone to hurting themselves. Good camera work puts the viewer right into the heart of the action and provides an adrenaline rush.

results.title: Land rights views: Number 9, July 1998
results.brief_description: A yearly magazine program dealing with issues associated with the Northern Land Council. This edition includes reports on the battle for Beetaloo, the Croker Island native title pearl deal, Kakadu management, Sorry day and the Barunga festival. Music from various Aboriginal acts is also featured.

results.title: Land rights views: Number 8, July 1997
results.creator_credit: Northern Land Council Media Unit and Northern Land Council
results.brief_description: A yearly magazine program dealing with issues associated with the Northern Land Council. This edition includes reports on the Jawoyn ‘Five Year Plan’, the Crocker Island seas native title claim, the Wik decision, a social impact study in the Kakadu region, the fight to save Railway Dam in Darwin and the ‘Black economy’ in the Top End. Music from various Aboriginal acts is also featured.

results.title: Shelter
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Wallhead and Vagabond Motion Picture Film Production Unit
results.brief_description:
A disturbed young man, frightened by the threat of nuclear war, wanders the streets in search of safety.

The film was shot on the city streets of Perth, Western Australia.

results.title: Two Girls and a Baby
results.creator_credit: Kelli Simpson, Penny Robins and Annamax Media
results.brief_description:
An entertaining look at the IVF process from the point of view of a lesbian couple as they deal with sperm banks, relationships, baby clothes, and community resistance.

Starring Claudia Karvan and Niky Wendt.

results.title: Hawkins' rivers
results.creator_credit: Robert Heazlewood, Eyelevel Production and TAS Television Productions
results.brief_description: Leo McKern narrates this modern day adventure set in twentieth century Tasmania. The true story concerns Tasmanian doctor and canoeist John Hawkins, who led the fight to save the Franklin River. It was, and still is a dilemma between developing the natural resources of the land or to forgo development at the price of suffering potential economic, political and social consequences. It is an issue that commanded the rest of the nation’s attention and continues to be pertinent today.

results.title: The Hearing Process
results.creator_credit: Public Service Board of Victoria and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture and Rural Affairs
results.brief_description: The Hearing Process is a function of the Victorian Public Service Board. It is freely available to all present and former officers and employees of the Public Service. This process is designed to protect the rights of all Public Service Officers and employees, and to enable staff to seek review of decisions which adversely affect them, other than decisions where another review or appeal body exists. The Victorian Public Service employes approximately 40,000 full and part time people. This video outlines the processes involved in presenting a case against unfair or inequitable treatment in the workplace.

results.title: Private eye
results.creator_credit: Peter McKinley, Geoff Tyson, Tasfilm Productions and Tasmania Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1970 film demonstrates the importance of eye safety and shows various methods of protection. The film opens with a sequence in film noir style of a ‘private eye’ working a case, with this gimmick interspersed throughout the film. It shows industrial working scenarios and various examples of eye protection, including safety glasses and helmets with visors.

Produced by Tasfilm Productions for the Department of Labour and Industry, Tasmania, and presented by Protector Sureguard.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.creator_credit: Ken McLean and New South Wales. Dept. of Education

results.title: The Marist way
results.brief_description: Locally produced documentary promoting the virtues of the monastic life, and teaching methods practise by the Marist Order. The film details the rigorous regime of scholastic, spiritual and athletic training the Brothers apply to their words in boarding schools across Australia. In conclusion, it asks which of their charges will assume their monastic vocation.
